title: Teff
summary: Eragrostis tef, also known as teff, Williams lovegrass[1] or annual bunch grass,[2] is an annual grass, a species of lovegrass native to the Horn of Africa, notably to modern-day Ethiopia.[3] It is cultivated for its edible seeds, also known as teff.  Teff was one of the earliest plants domesticated.  It is one of the most important staple crops in Ethiopia and Eritrea.
